head.title: Arts, Briefly; Jean Nouvel to Design New Paris Concert Hall

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

hedline.hl1: Arts, Briefly; Jean Nouvel to Design New Paris Concert Hall

body.head.byline: By ALAN RIDING; Compiled by Lawrence Van Gelder

block.p: The French architect Jean Nouvel, below, has been chosen to design the first large concert hall to be built in Paris since the Salle Pleyel opened in 1927. The $260 million hall, to be known as the Philharmonie de Paris, will be built in the northeastern neighborhood La Villette beside the existing Cité de la Musique. The 2,400-seat hall, to be completed in 2012, will be Mr. Nouvel's third major project in Paris, after the Institut du Monde Arabe and the Musée du Quai Branly. Mr. Nouvel's design will be unveiled next week. It was chosen over designs by Francis Soler, Christian de Portzamparc, Zaha Hadid, the Vienna-based firm Coop Himmelb(l)au and the Dutch firm MvRdV.
